title: U.S., China officials to meet on curbing fentanyl supply
description: After a long freeze and political tensions, Washington and Beijing are moving forward on countering illegal narcotics trafficking.

title: U.S. troops killed, wounded in Jordan attack blamed on Iranian proxies
description: President Biden blames Iran-backed militant groups for the drone attack in Jordan that led to the first such fatalities of American troops, and vows to “hold all those responsible to account.”

title: Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso break away from key West African bloc
description: All three countries are led by military juntas, who issued a joint statement announcing their withdrawal from ECOWAS.

title: Why countries are pulling funding from the U.N. agency for Palestinians
description: Several nations, including the United States, said they would stop funding UNRWA after Israel alleged that agency employees were involved in Hamas’s attack.

title: Ukraine says defense officials stole $40 million meant for ammunition
description: The State Security Service implicated top officials in an embezzlement scheme and said the money — state funds, not foreign aid — is being recovered.

title: Surging Red Sea violence could imperil a fragile Yemen
description: A permanent cease-fire appeared imminent. Then Hamas attacked Israel, Israel struck back, and Yemen’s Houthis began attacking international shipping.

title: Middle East conflict live updates: Suspending UNRWA funding threatens urgent humanitarian work, agency warns
description: Several nations followed the U.S. in suspending funding for the U.N. agency after allegations that some of its staff were involved in the Oct. 7 attack.
